# LangDAG

> LLM Conversations as Directed Acyclic Graphs

LangDAG is a high-performance Go tool for orchestrating LLM interactions. Everything is a node â€” a root node defines a conversation tree, and prompting from any node extends or branches the tree.

## Key Features

- Node-centric API: one concept (nodes), one verb (prompt)
- Native streaming via SSE
- Branch from any node to explore alternative paths
- Persistent storage: SQLite (default)
- ~1ms overhead, single static binary, zero runtime dependencies

## SDKs

- Python: `pip install langdag`
- Go: `go get github.com/langdag/langdag-go`
- TypeScript: `npm install langdag`

## Quick Start

```bash
# Run the server
git clone https://github.com/aduermael/langdag && cd langdag
go run ./cmd/langdag serve

# Or install directly
go install github.com/aduermael/langdag/cmd/langdag@latest
```

## CLI

```bash
langdag prompt "What is LangDAG?"           # new conversation
langdag prompt <node-id> "Tell me more"     # continue from node
langdag prompt                              # interactive mode
langdag ls                                  # list root nodes
langdag show <id>                           # show node tree
langdag rm <id>                             # delete node + subtree
```

## REST API

```
POST   /prompt                  Start new conversation tree
POST   /nodes/{id}/prompt       Continue from existing node
GET    /nodes                   List root nodes
GET    /nodes/{id}              Get a single node
GET    /nodes/{id}/tree         Get full tree from node
DELETE /nodes/{id}              Delete node and subtree
GET    /health                  Health check
```

## Links

- Website: https://langdag.com
